value.content: This article provides information about the changes in Firefox 100 that will affect developers. Firefox 100 was released on May 3, 2022.

value.title: CSS
value.content: • CSS media features for dynamic-range and video-dynamic-range are now supported. You can now test whether a user agent or an output device supports the combination of brightness, contrast ratio, and color depth by using dynamic-range and in the video plane by using video-dynamic-range (bug 1751217).

value.title: HTTP
value.content:
Removals

  • The non-standard Large-Allocation HTTP header has been removed (bug 1598759).

value.title: APIs
value.content:
• WritableStream, WritableStreamDefaultWriter, WritableStreamDefaultController, and ReadableStream.pipeTo() are now supported (bug 1759597).

DOM

  • Code can now use the static method AbortSignal.timeout(). This returns an AbortSignal that can be used to automatically abort an operation with TimeoutError after a specified time (bug 1753309).

value.title: WebAssembly
value.content: • WebAssembly now supports exceptions that can be thrown and caught in either WebAssembly or JavaScript (or some other runtime), crossing between the environment boundaries if not handled. The JavaScript representations of WebAssembly exceptions are WebAssembly.Exception and WebAssembly.Tag (bug 1759217).

value.title: WebDriver conformance (Marionette)
value.content: • Added support for user prompts (e.g. alert) on Android (bug 1708105).

value.title: Changes for add-on developers
value.content:
• The color_scheme and content_color_scheme properties are added to theme manifest key and available in the theme API. These properties enable a theme to override whether a light or dark color scheme is automatically applied to the chrome or content (bug 1708105).
  • You can now create a muted tab using tabs.create() with the new muted property in the createProperties object (bug 1372100).
